meanings.definition: A substance added to a material to slow down a chemical reaction or drying process.
meanings.sent1: The painter used a retarder to make the paint dry more slowly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic added a retarder to the glue to give him more time to adjust the pieces.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the retarder, causing the experiment to take much longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The retarder in the varnish acted like a time-stopping potion, freezing the drying process.
meanings.sent5: The retarder was like a magical brake, gently easing the speed of the chemical reaction.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that delays or hinders progress.
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic was a real retarder on our journey.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination can be a major retarder in achieving your goals.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather acted as a natural retarder to our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent4: Fear can be a powerful retarder, holding us back from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The negative thoughts were like invisible retarders, slowing down our progress.

meanings.definition: A device used to slow down the speed of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The truck driver activated the retarder to slow down the heavy vehicle on the steep slope.
meanings.sent2: The bicycle had a special retarder that helped control the speed while going downhill.
meanings.sent3: The new car model boasted an advanced retarder system for safer driving.
meanings.sent4: The train's retarder functioned like a gentle hand, gradually reducing its speed.
meanings.sent5: The ship's retarder was like a secret weapon, silently controlling its velocity in the water.
